00036 /* EM header files */
00037 #include "em_device.h"

00039 /* Drivers */
00040 #include "em_emu.h"
00041 #include "em_acmp.h"
00042 #include "capsense.h"

00047 static volatile uint8_t currentChannel;
00049 static volatile bool measurementComplete;
00050 
00051 /**************************************************************************/
00055 static const bool channelsInUse[ACMP_CHANNELS] = CAPSENSE_CH_IN_USE;
00056 
00057 /**************************************************************************/
00061 static volatile uint32_t channelValues[ACMP_CHANNELS] = { 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0 };
00062 
00063 /**************************************************************************/
00067 static volatile uint32_t channelMaxValues[ACMP_CHANNELS] = { 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1 };
00068 
00071 /**************************************************************************/
00078 void TIMER0_IRQHandler(void)
00079 {
00080   uint32_t count;
00081 
00082   /* Stop timers */
00083   TIMER0->CMD = TIMER_CMD_STOP;
00084   TIMER1->CMD = TIMER_CMD_STOP;
00085 
00086   /* Clear interrupt flag */
00087   TIMER0->IFC = TIMER_IFC_OF;
00088 
00089   /* Read out value of TIMER1 */
00090   count = TIMER1->CNT;
00091 
00092   /* Store value in channelValues */
00093   channelValues[currentChannel] = count;
00094 
00095   /* Update channelMaxValues */
00096   if (count > channelMaxValues[currentChannel])
00097     channelMaxValues[currentChannel] = count;
00098 
00099   measurementComplete = true;
00100 }
00101 
00102 /**************************************************************************/
00107 uint32_t CAPSENSE_getVal(uint8_t channel)
00108 {
00109   return channelValues[channel];
00110 }
00111 
00112 /**************************************************************************/
00117 uint32_t CAPSENSE_getNormalizedVal(uint8_t channel)
00118 {
00119   uint32_t max = channelMaxValues[channel];
00120   return (channelValues[channel] << 8) / max;
00121 }
00122 
00123 /**************************************************************************/
00129 bool CAPSENSE_getPressed(uint8_t channel)
00130 {
00131   uint32_t treshold;
00132   /* Treshold is set to 12.5% below the maximum value */
00133   /* This calculation is performed in two steps because channelMaxValues is
00134    * volatile. */
00135   treshold  = channelMaxValues[channel];
00136   treshold -= channelMaxValues[channel] >> 3;
00137 
00138   if (channelValues[channel] < treshold)
00139   {
00140     return true;
00141   }
00142   return false;
00143 }
00144 
00145 /**************************************************************************/
00150 int32_t CAPSENSE_getSliderPosition(void)
00151 {
00152   int      i;
00153   int      minPos = -1;
00154   uint32_t minVal = 224; /* 0.875 * 256 */
00155   /* Values used for interpolation. There is two more which represents the edges.
00156    * This makes the interpolation code a bit cleaner as we do not have to make special
00157    * cases for handling them */
00158   uint32_t interpol[6] = { 255, 255, 255, 255, 255, 255 };
00159 
00160   /* The calculated slider position. */
00161   int position;
00162 
00163   /* Iterate through the 4 slider bars and calculate the current value divided by
00164    * the maximum value multiplied by 256.
00165    * Note that there is an offset of 1 between channelValues and interpol.
00166    * This is done to make interpolation easier.
00167    */
00168   for (i = 1; i < 5; i++)
00169   {
00170     /* interpol[i] will be in the range 0-256 depending on channelMax */
00171     interpol[i]  = channelValues[i - 1] << 8;
00172     interpol[i] /= channelMaxValues[i - 1];
00173     /* Find the minimum value and position */
00174     if (interpol[i] < minVal)
00175     {
00176       minVal = interpol[i];
00177       minPos = i;
00178     }
00179   }
00180   /* Check if the slider has not been touched */
00181   if (minPos == -1)
00182     return -1;
00183 
00184   /* Start position. Shift by 4 to get additional resolution. */
00185   /* Because of the interpol trick earlier we have to substract one to offset that effect */
00186   position = (minPos - 1) << 4;
00187 
00188   /* Interpolate with pad to the left */
00189   position -= ((256 - interpol[minPos - 1]) << 3)
00190               / (256 - interpol[minPos]);
00191 
00192   /* Interpolate with pad to the right */
00193   position += ((256 - interpol[minPos + 1]) << 3)
00194               / (256 - interpol[minPos]);
00195 
00196   return position;
00197 }
00198 
00199 /**************************************************************************/
00204 void CAPSENSE_Sense(void)
00205 {
00206   /* Use the default STK capacative sensing setup and enable it */
00207   ACMP_Enable(ACMP_CAPSENSE);
00208 
00209   uint8_t ch;
00210   /* Iterate trough all channels */
00211   for (currentChannel = 0; currentChannel < ACMP_CHANNELS; currentChannel++)
00212   {
00213     /* If this channel is not in use, skip to the next one */
00214     if (!channelsInUse[currentChannel])
00215     {
00216       continue;
00217     }
00218 
00219     /* Set up this channel in the ACMP. */
00220     ch = currentChannel;
00221     ACMP_CapsenseChannelSet(ACMP_CAPSENSE, (ACMP_Channel_TypeDef) ch);
00222 
00223     /* Reset timers */
00224     TIMER0->CNT = 0;
00225     TIMER1->CNT = 0;
00226 
00227     measurementComplete = false;
00228 
00229     /* Start timers */
00230     TIMER0->CMD = TIMER_CMD_START;
00231     TIMER1->CMD = TIMER_CMD_START;
00232 
00233     /* Wait for measurement to complete */
00234     while ( measurementComplete == false )
00235     {
00236       EMU_EnterEM1();
00237     }
00238   }
00239 
00240   /* Disable ACMP while not sensing to reduce power consumption */
00241   ACMP_Disable(ACMP_CAPSENSE);
00242 }
00243 
00244 /**************************************************************************/
00252 void CAPSENSE_Init(void)
00253 {
00254   /* Use the default STK capacative sensing setup */
00255   ACMP_CapsenseInit_TypeDef capsenseInit = ACMP_CAPSENSE_INIT_DEFAULT;
00256 
00257   /* Enable TIMER0, TIMER1, ACMP_CAPSENSE and PRS clock */
00258   CMU->HFPERCLKDIV |= CMU_HFPERCLKDIV_HFPERCLKEN;
00259   CMU->HFPERCLKEN0 |= CMU_HFPERCLKEN0_TIMER0
00260                       | CMU_HFPERCLKEN0_TIMER1
00261                       | ACMP_CAPSENSE_CLKEN
00262                       | CMU_HFPERCLKEN0_PRS;
00263 
00264   /* Initialize TIMER0 - Prescaler 2^9, top value 10, interrupt on overflow */
00265   TIMER0->CTRL = TIMER_CTRL_PRESC_DIV512;
00266   TIMER0->TOP  = 10;
00267   TIMER0->IEN  = TIMER_IEN_OF;
00268   TIMER0->CNT  = 0;
00269 
00270   /* Initialize TIMER1 - Prescaler 2^10, clock source CC1, top value 0xFFFF */
00271   TIMER1->CTRL = TIMER_CTRL_PRESC_DIV1024 | TIMER_CTRL_CLKSEL_CC1;
00272   TIMER1->TOP  = 0xFFFF;
00273 
00274   /*Set up TIMER1 CC1 to trigger on PRS channel 0 */
00275   TIMER1->CC[1].CTRL = TIMER_CC_CTRL_MODE_INPUTCAPTURE /* Input capture      */
00276                        | TIMER_CC_CTRL_PRSSEL_PRSCH0   /* PRS channel 0      */
00277                        | TIMER_CC_CTRL_INSEL_PRS       /* PRS input selected */
00278                        | TIMER_CC_CTRL_ICEVCTRL_RISING /* PRS on rising edge */
00279                        | TIMER_CC_CTRL_ICEDGE_BOTH;    /* PRS on rising edge */
00280 
00281   /*Set up PRS channel 0 to trigger on ACMP1 output*/
00282   PRS->CH[0].CTRL = PRS_CH_CTRL_EDSEL_POSEDGE      /* Posedge triggers action */
00283                     | PRS_CH_CTRL_SOURCESEL_ACMP_CAPSENSE      /* PRS source */
00284                     | PRS_CH_CTRL_SIGSEL_ACMPOUT_CAMPSENSE;    /* PRS source */
00285 
00286   /* Set up ACMP1 in capsense mode */
00287   ACMP_CapsenseInit(ACMP_CAPSENSE, &capsenseInit);
00288 
00289   /* Enable TIMER0 interrupt */
00290   NVIC_EnableIRQ(TIMER0_IRQn);
00291 }
